intro: Serpocaulon lasiopus, commonly known as the rough-stemmed serpocaulon, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features wiry, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in whorls. Its flowers are inconspicuous, consisting of tiny, greenish-white blooms that appear in clusters. Serpocaulon lasiopus is known for its ability to thrive in wet soils and is often found in association with other moisture-loving plants.
